about: This is the /other page that only exists to illustrate routing with `localizeHref()`.

home.title: Full Stack Developer
home.summary: Junior Full Stack Developer with a solid foundation in Java and Python. Currently pursuing a Master’s in Agile Software Development at the University of Alcalá, where I work on projects using Spring Boot, microservices, and CI/CD. Committed to continuous learning and collaborative teamwork.
home.CV: Graduated Magna Cum Laude in Computer Science and currently pursuing a Master’s in Agile Software Development at the University of Alcalá. Proficient in Java, Python, and Spring Boot, with experience in scalable microservices and CI/CD pipelines for reliable deployments. In technical support, I automated processes with Python, reducing errors by 40% and optimizing fleet logistics. I excel in collaborating with multidisciplinary teams, ensuring code quality through testing and applying cybersecurity principles. Adaptable and proactive, I share knowledge and explore trends in music, comics, and new technologies.

projects.title: My Projects

p1.name: Travel Comfort Project
p1.description: Travel Comfort Project is an online store specializing in suitcases and luggage. The application allows users to browse products, manage a shopping cart, and optionally access an administrative panel for inventory maintenance.

p2.name: Formula 1 Portal
p2.description: Web application for managing a Formula 1 portal, allowing fans to access news and polls, teams to perform performance calculations, and administrators to manage site content and users.

p3.name: Movie Management with Microservices
p3.description: This project is the evolution of a web application for movie management, initially developed during a Frameworks and Backend course. It has been expanded and improved with new functionalities and microservices integration, reinforcing learning about distributed architectures and service communication, similar to Filmaffinity.

p4.name: MovieCards Project: Service Decoupling and Quality Improvement
p4.description: This project focuses on refactoring and modernizing an existing application, MovieCards, by transforming a previously integrated service into an independent, cloud-deployable solution. The main objective is to establish a more flexible and scalable microservices-based architecture, allowing core functionality to be consumed by various platforms (web, mobile, desktop) in a decoupled manner.

1.description: My job involved providing technical support to the company's 60 branches nationwide. This included helping users resolve network or system equipment issues, configuring IT equipment and VoIP phones. I also performed database queries to generate necessary company reports and documented internal IT department processes. Additionally, I created scripts to automate software updates and network performance monitoring, and tracked company vehicles using GPS devices.

2.description: As an IT technician, I performed the following tasks at the center: installation, configuration, and software/hardware updates for devices; troubleshooting technical issues affecting system and network performance; collaborating with the cybersecurity manager to enhance software protection through pentesting; and teamwork with personnel from other areas to ensure the security and quality of IT services.

1.degree: Master's Degree in Agile Web Software Development
1.description: This master's program trains me as a Full Stack developer, mastering agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban) and continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) practices. I have applied this knowledge in projects such as the development of a Formula 1 web portal in Java with Spring Boot and Thymeleaf, the implementation of CI/CD with GitHub Actions, and the creation of a movie portal with 5 microservices for user registration and comments. Acquired competencies include applying agile knowledge and methodologies in the design, development, and implementation of web applications, creating enterprise applications based on microservices architecture, and developing complex, interactive, and responsive web applications with high usability.

2.description: I completed my studies with Magna Cum Laude honors, achieving an average GPA of 93.6. During this period, I gained solid competencies in programming, covering languages such as Java, C++, HTML, and JavaScript, in addition to mastering database design and network and systems administration. I complemented my academic training with an active volunteer role in the IT department, where I collaborated on essential tasks such as the installation and maintenance of computer equipment. Additionally, I had the opportunity to serve as an assistant to a Physics professor, which involved supporting in the preparation and evaluation of classes.
